div.div: Opened #31478 Suggest changing some JSON files to JSONC
opened in zed-industries/zed
Pushed 1 commit in aurexav/zed
on branch main

Add ability to manage dock size via command/shortcut
Signed-off-by: Xavier Lau <x@acg.box>
Pushed 1 commit in aurexav/zed
on branch main
Add ability to manage dock size via command/shortcut
Commented on #31366 Add ability to manage pane size via command/shortcut
opened by aurexav in zed-industries/zed

This is very confusing overall and wrong to do in the release notes at least — so I'll have to adjust them before merging. Yes, I noticed many places in Zed named it "pane", while VSCode calls it a "sidebar", and the current code calls it a "dock". This needs to be addressed. :) On that terms, the plan in the PR seems great. I'll start the code.
Commented on #11 Inifite loading "Waiting for Context Server"
opened by aurexav in LoamStudios/zed-mcp-server-github
It appears after few hours. I have no idea why.
Closed #11 Inifite loading "Waiting for Context Server"
opened in LoamStudios/zed-mcp-server-github
Commented on #31366 Add increase/decrease dock size actions
opened by aurexav in zed-industries/zed

Do we understand each other well? Yes, please check the description. In Zed context, I would call it a "pane" to eliminate ambiguity. The request would be similar to introducing VSCode’s workbench.action.increase/decreaseViewSize to Zed. However, there are some differences to note. VSCode uses a "global" sidebar that contains the tool panels, whereas Zed has a separate pane (sidebar) for each tool. Therefore, it wouldn’t be a direct replication. I think this is because the different "pane" mangement way between VSCode and Zed. I would use the word "pane" instead of "dock" from now.
Commented on #31366 Add increase/decrease dock size actions
opened by aurexav in zed-industries/zed
@SomeoneToIgnore updated, please check.

Yep, I found this too. I’ll update this while we decide on the final shortcut!
Reviewed #31366 Add increase/decrease dock size actions
opened in zed-industries/zed
Opened #11 Inifite loading "Waiting for Context Server"
opened in LoamStudios/zed-mcp-server-github
Commented on #31366 Add increase/decrease dock size actions
opened by aurexav in zed-industries/zed

To me, it would be much more complicated to keep two distinct sets of actions for the same idea. We’ve already remembered many such small things, and I still hope we can make developers' lives easier. Just use the "increase" and "decrease" – it’s pretty clear. As I mentioned, I opened this PR because I’m a VSCode user. I recently discovered these missing actions/shortcuts in Zed, so I wanted to add it. This could also help people who came from VSCode without introduce too many differences. That could be handled differently in the new handlers at least, so we do not resize on the wrong direction called. On the other hand, uniform "either way" approach is less confusing and poises us better for merging these actions into "increase/decrease" actions later. Actually, I did see some code to handle this, but the logic is quite unclear.
https://github.com/zed-industries/zed/blob/206be2b3480a3b77dc3f87f57e832edeffda96a5/crates/workspace/src/pane_group.rs#L627
But that check only works for an inactive pane. I don't know why.
https://github.com/zed-industries/zed/blob/206be2b3480a3b77dc3f87f57e832edeffda96a5/crates/workspace/src/workspace.rs#L3547
It's also important to maintain the code logic simple especially for such large project. I do not agree with this thought as this might break someone's keymap for nothing. It’s okay to me. I don’t care about this too much, but they have almost the same effect. Some housekeeping work could help the large codebase clean and clear, especially since I’ve noticed a magic number maximum = px(10000.0) .
All in all, I still recommend changing to increase/decrease.
Commented on #31366 Add increase/decrease dock size actions
opened by aurexav in zed-industries/zed

* removing something from Vim seems a bit excessive, as I imagined we are good already with the `vim::` -> `workflow::` transition only + the deprecation statement. We would keep the `ResizePane` part (instead of the new, proposed `Dock` one) to keep people less confused.
Ok, I mean I'll reuse most of the code. Delete from vim and move to workspace. I have to point out one thing: I think this is overdesigned and adds unnecessary cognitive load for users. Why should users have to decide whether it’s width or height? The program could easily handle this automatically. A pane at the bottom can only get taller or shorter, and a pane on the side can only get wider or narrower. Why force users to make that judgment? Plus, this approach eats up extra shortcut keys. Also, I’ve noticed that whether you pass "horizontal" or "vertical," the pane’s size changes either way. The only difference is the step offset for the size adjustment. And I found that "ResetPaneSize" and "MaximumPaneSize" is also useful, I'll move them to the workspace too. I found one more thing, "MaximumPaneSize" is almost the same as "workspace::ToggleZoom" (shift+escape). I think this can be removed.
Pushed 1 commit in aurexav/polkadot-sdk
on branch auto-retry
Ininite retry
Commented on #31366 Add Increase/Decrease Dock Size Actions
opened by aurexav in zed-industries/zed

Currently, my thought is:
Remove all implementation in Vim. Add it to the deprecated action. Use the global one I implemented. Vim’s can control increasing and decreasing the width and height of the window, but I’d like to keep things simple and only allow users to increase and decrease the size of the active panels. If a user doesn’t want to adjust the size of a panel, they can simply hide it. However, I believe in most cases, users prefer the "left == right" layout.
